perturbation.explanation: By removing the detailed specifications for each service, such as the T1 line, the specific software versions, the storage limits (150 MB), and the 1-hour limit on Web site administration services, the modified text creates uncertainty and potential disputes. While the services are generally listed, the lack of specific parameters could allow i-on to provide significantly reduced or altered services compared to what the Customer might reasonably expect based on the original text. The term 'as deemed necessary by i-on' introduces an element of subjectivity that contradicts the initial intent of providing well-defined services. Also the $200 rate has been removed.

perturbation.original_text: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee in the amount of $450. The Customer is responsible for paying the recurring monthly fees by the 5th day of each month beginning in April 1, 1999. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a timely manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
perturbation.changed_text: The Customer is responsible for paying i-on the recurring monthly fee. The Customer acknowledges that failure to pay such fees in a manner will result in the interruption or discontinuation of services for the Hosted Site.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the explicit mention of the amount i.e. '$450' creates an ambiguity regarding the payment obligation. While the customer is still responsible for paying the recurring monthly fee, the absence of a specified amount introduces uncertainty and could lead to disputes about the correct amount. The change weakens the enforcement because the precise amount to be paid is no longer defined.

perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period of six (6) months, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed for one (1) or more one (1) month periods unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement, which notice must be given not less than fifteen (15) days before the end of the respective initial or renewal term.
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement for the Hosted Site shall commence upon April 1, 1999 and shall continue for a period, unless earlier terminated in accordance with provisions hereof. This Agreement shall automatically be renewed unless either the Customer or i-on gives notice to the other party of its intention not to renew the Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the specific time periods (six months initial term, one-month renewal periods, and fifteen-day notice) introduces ambiguity. The lack of a defined period creates an indefinite arrangement which conflicts with standard contract practice and creates difficulty in determining the actual term of the agreement. The absence of the 15 days notic period affects enforcement.
